title: Moroccan Fish Tajine
summary: Moroccan Fish Tajine is a gluten free, dairy free, whole 30, and pescatarian recipe with 1 servings. For $33.67 per serving, this recipe covers 92% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 2725 calories, 246g of protein, and 128g of fat. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. It works best as a main course, and is done in roughly 1 hour and 15 minutes. Head to the store and pick up chili powder, extra virgin olive oil, ginger powder, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the ginger powder you could follow this main course with the Eggless Ginger Cookies | Chewy Ginger Molasses Cookies as a dessert. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. Overall, this recipe earns a solid spoonacular score of 73%. If you like this recipe, you might also like recipes such as Moroccan Fish Tajine, Moroccan Crock Pot Tajine, and Moroccan Chicken Tajine.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Rabble Pinot Gris with a 4.9 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Rabble Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Alsatian-inspired with notes of lime, green apple, white flower and wetstone. Following the nose are flavors of Anjou pear, white nectarine andcitrus. The vibrant and crisp acidity balances out this medium bodied wineand carries it through the lingering finish.

instructions: Finely chop parsley and garlic and put in medium bowl. Add all spices and 2 tablespoons oil. Toss together with hands.Chop potatoes into 1/3 inch thick circles. Chop tomatoes into quarters. Chop onion into 6 wedges. Chop bell peppers into large rings. Trim asparagus.Put all vegetables onto a large baking dish or tajine pan, there is no method to this just pile them on. Drizzle the rest of the olive oil over the veggies. At this point, take a little of all the spices used and lightly sprinkle over veggies (just a few pinches of each).Take the whole trout and stuff a small handful of the parsley mixture into each (this should be about a third of the mixture for all the fish) . Rub a little olive oil on the trout if you want to help it crisp the skin.Take a third of the parsley mixture and evenly coat the veggies on the pan. Lay the fish down on top of the veggies and cover the fish with the remaining parsley mixture.Bake in a preheated 400F oven for about an hour or until the fish is crisp on the outside and the veggies are browned and roasted.Enjoy!

steps.step: Finely chop parsley and garlic and put in medium bowl.

Add all spices and 2 tablespoons oil. Toss together with hands.Chop potatoes into 1/3 inch thick circles. Chop tomatoes into quarters. Chop onion into 6 wedges. Chop bell peppers into large rings. Trim asparagus.Put all vegetables onto a large baking dish or tajine pan, there is no method to this just pile them on.

Drizzle the rest of the olive oil over the veggies. At this point, take a little of all the spices used and lightly sprinkle over veggies (just a few pinches of each).Take the whole trout and stuff a small handful of the parsley mixture into each (this should be about a third of the mixture for all the fish) . Rub a little olive oil on the trout if you want to help it crisp the skin.Take a third of the parsley mixture and evenly coat the veggies on the pan.
Lay the fish down on top of the veggies and cover the fish with the remaining parsley mixture.
Bake in a preheated 400F oven for about an hour or until the fish is crisp on the outside and the veggies are browned and roasted.Enjoy!
